My money is on five to ten more years; mass media in the usa lags at least a decade behind what the society wants.  It took pacific rim for there to be a not michael bay mecha film and the west has been clammering for those for years.  Eventually it'll happen, but like you said they're going to have to be creative and start taking risks again for anime to be brought over.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a21451636872333aae0700#post_54a21451636872333aae0700
I see one problem. Anime in Japan is so strong for three reasons: strong Japanese culture from which much of it is derived, animation is not frowned upon as much (the problem as you can see, largely a generational thing), and let's be real western anime audiences are very selective about what is watched so it's a pool of higher quality shows.

So I think in about 10-20 years when it is taken more seriously and as a result pursued by the talent

topics.body:
Why can't they make a western movie that actually works like an anime?

I mean, we're not aiming for Iron Man or The Other Guys. We're not looking for conflict, evil and hardship. We're just looking for a western movie that's fun all around like a fantasy. 

No fighting, no yelling, no loss of someone, no deaths, no self-conflicts, no angst, no long-lasting anger, no regret.

Just once, a western movie like that.

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a2168763687232abce0800#post_54a2168763687232abce0800
[bq="Whatevs"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a21451636872333aae0700#post_54a21451636872333aae0700
I see one problem. Anime in Japan is so strong for three reasons: strong Japanese culture from which much of it is derived, animation is not frowned upon as much (the problem as you can see, largely a generational thing), and let's be real western anime audiences are very selective about what is watched so it's a pool of higher quality shows.

So I think in about 10-20 years when it is taken more seriously and as a result pursued by the talent[/bq]
Okay; I have to call bullshit here.  It's not that your theory is wrong, but rather actual japanese culture is different from how it's portrayed and that not a lot of westerners understand how socially conservative japan is.

Animation in japan is massively looked down upon by society, but you were right about it being a generational thing.  Right now in japan animation fans and such are the residential kicking bag for all the country's problems to the point it's the equivalent of the "thanks obama".
Country is in economic stagnation?  Thanks otakus.
Country's birth rates are down due to economic stagnation?  Thanks otakus.
China-Japan relations are strained due to them both vying for resources?  Thanks otakus.
Massive anti-immigration stances preventing immigration to offset the large scale population decline due to old age?  Thanks otakus.

There's a lot of problems going on in japan right now because the country is in economic stagnation and decline and otakus are just outright getting the metaphorical crap kicked out of them for shit they didn't do.  Anime is looked down upon as just for children and adult anime fans are getting blamed for things that doesn't make a lick of goddamn sense.

I know it was a bit of tangent, but it's a interesting tangent cause you are totally 100% right about there being a generational issue in japan.  The generational issue in japan is rather that the older generations have completely ran the country into the fucking ground and are taking it out on the younger generations.

[/tangent]
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
